pr_title: SAK-43073 handle scenario where extended due date has passed and asse…

timeline.message: SAK-43073 handle scenario where extended due date has passed and assessment is auto-submitted before extended late acceptance

timeline.author: ottenhoff

replies.bodyText:
Could it be this? https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-36804
"If auto-submit runs after excepted due date while excepted student is in quiz, quiz is not auto-submitted"
It seems that's the jira where that condition was originally added, then it was moved to other places.
replies.author: bgarciaentornos

replies.bodyText:
Seems like you added it in
SAM-3313 autosubmit job needs to process excepted late allowed submissions (#5024)
replies.author: ottenhoff

replies.bodyText: Yeah, but I think I extracted it from the query and added the Java condition instead because otherwise more cases than due were being filtered. I can't remember it very well tbh, but I'd say it can happen, maybe settings being modified afterwards?
replies.author: bgarciaentornos

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure, it seems a little strange. If the settings were modified to allow further submissions, I would think this would involve extending the retract date also, so I'm not sure how you could get a submission attempt date after the retract date. Maybe exceptions?
replies.author: bjones86

replies.bodyText: Yeah I keep thinking it was just a crude way to sense an exception? I don't know if we should remove it. What do you guys think? I can't say I've ever come across a submission that was not submitted because of this clause. But it doesn't look right either.
replies.author: ottenhoff

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I'm a little torn. On one hand, we haven't seen issues that this condition causes, but yet it doesn't seem like it should be there logically.
replies.author: bjones86

replies.bodyText:
Okay, let's leave it unless Bernardo thinks it should be removed.
Can I get an approval on this PR? It fixes an important bug.
replies.author: ottenhoff

replies.bodyText: Yes, I'd leave it. And sorry for not approving it before, thought some other reviewer had already done it!
replies.author: bgarciaentornos

timeline.message: handle scenario where extended time allows late
